intro: Eriogonum compositum var. lancifolium, commonly known as the lanceleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in disturbed areas due to its adaptability. The species is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
